Posts.Content: Dec 9, 2011 11:22AM eine wrote: So happy for you queenie!  I hope to have same good report on Monday after my mammogram and MRI 3 1/2 yrs post dx.  Much anxiety but am inspired to read all these positive posts and reaffirming thoughts!!!!  I will let you all know......
Posts.Title: just got home from mammo, 3 yrs NED! myrtle1 pupfoster1

Posts.Content: Nov 18, 2011 04:59AM eine wrote: I also just had my implants removed and feel almost worse than my lumpectomy. Had rads, delayed recon for three years, had TEs put in March 2011, expansion painful and put on antibiotics twice, exchange surgery Sept. 2011, developed another infection, tried antibiotics but implants had to be removed Oct. 28th. My PS blames the radiation but also thinks we can try again once i "Heal".  Haha. Not sure what that means.  I am very depressed and wondered if anyone has had success with fat grafting.  So scared to try implants again, although the surgery would be just one this time since the expansion already did the stretch job. I also am devastated when seeing my chest....scars are daunting.
Posts.Title: Help-complications force me to join this "club" jtslg lollypop59

Posts.Content: Mar 9, 2013 12:26AM eine wrote: I remember so well my surgeon telling me when I was diagnosed that "One year from now, this will be a blessing in disguise".  But at the time, I couldn't imagine that being possible.  To get through this is best when you have support from all who love you and to know you will be okay.  This is war and you will win.  Forge ahead and stay with this forum because it offers so much comfort.  I am with you in spirit and know what you are experiencing in every way.  I would also recommend you discuss any reconstruction before any treatment.  This is important to do BEFORE you undergo any treatment.   I learned this the hard way.  Hugs and peace and we are here for you.

Posts.Title: All clear mammo for me too. caaclark eine

Posts.Content: Nov 30, 2011 12:42PM eine wrote: Hi I can relate.  I had a failed recon and had my implants removed Oct. 28th, 2011 after infection.  I had lumpectomy and rads so the failure rate was 5% per my PS, didn't sound too bad, but I guess someone has to be that 5%. My breasts are now in worse shape than before the attempt and I have been very depressed about it. My ps thinks we can try again after I "heal for a long time", whatever that means! I have a mammogram in two weeks and am concerned about the additional scar tissue since the recon surgery. My breasts are very dense and I am always worrying about recurrence. I am getting a second (and third and fourth) opinion for future options, and would love to hear how you are doing.
Posts.Title: I miss my breasts! topless karen1956
